name: Dried Cherry Bread
author: EMERALDCITYJEWEL
summary: I was looking for a muffin or quick bread recipe that called for yogurt but all were a bit too wholesome for me so I dreamed up this dried cherry bread. But at least I kept the oats! I am sure this batter could be used to make muffins too. A streusel topping or powdered sugar glaze would be extra naughty and extra good too but I didn't want to be too naughty.
ingredients: 1 cup white chocolate baking chips, lightly dusted with flour
directions: Pour boiling water over dried cherries in a bowl and let sit to plump up for 15 minutes
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan
Beat eggs lightly in a bowl
Add sugar, oil, butter, buttermilk, yogurt, and vanilla extract
Combine flour, oatmeal, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a separate, larger bowl
Add egg mixture, white chocolate chips, and cherries
Pour into the prepared loaf pan
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 45 minutes to 1 hour, checking at 35 minutes to account for different ovens
If bread begins to brown too much, lightly cover the top with aluminum foil
Let set for 5 to 10 minutes in the pan before inverting loaf onto a wire rack to cool completely
